article_metadata.description: Women have been told since the earliest debates about Obamacare that they would be among its biggest winners. Some of the best-advertised features of the law, such as first-dollar health-care coverage and a prohibition against charging women higher insurance premiums, were specifically designed to make the law attractive to women. But women just aren't buying it.
article_metadata.author: Carrie Lukas

og.title: Obamacare vs. Women's Choices
